result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry W Rubin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Larry W Rubin in court with attorney Francis P Raff.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 16CM42, 15CM551 & 15CM558
MUST POST $250.00 CASH (CASH ALREADY POSTED)
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.W. OR HER RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Larry Rubin present in court with attorney Francis Raff. Matthew Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Trial Reserved. Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Defendant Larry Rubin present in court with attorney Francis Raff. Matthew Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
